boardgame.name: Car Wars (Sixth Edition): Dice Bag

A 6" x 9" satin-lined, drawstring dice bag with Car Wars art on both sides; Redline on one side and Superflash on the reverse.

This item was included as part of the Car Wars Double Ace Box.

boardgame.name: The Great City of Parapette Part 2
boardgame.description:
From Patreon:

Exploration of the City of Parapette with Part 2! In this module, you will discover the unique 4-quartered layout of the city and a whole encounter table for each of those quarters, allowing you loads of story-prompt-potential for exploring the streets of this huge castle town.

I'm afraid I don't have the first chapter of 'Rookstone Legacy' available yet. Its very nearly finished but I want it to be perfect and complete before I release it. Its been a crazy month with work and also going to London MCM Comiccon which took up a whole weekend! It was a great show though, awesome to be able to start going back to events!

boardgame.name: Arachnoir
boardgame.description:
The bug city of Basin Quarter has been infested by pests from the "Hive" syndicate. Players are spider detectives moving through the city to capture these pests.

Each round, dice are rolled to generate a small pool of movement options. Players simultaneously move their spiders on the board, drawing threads along their path. When an area is bounded by threads, it becomes a webbed area that can be used to catch pests.

Each pest requires a specific condition to be caught, such as web size or spider position. Players must plan their paths carefully, and decide what targets to pursue or abandon.

Victory points are gained through the capture of these pests, as well as a varied number of side objectives. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Lords of Ragnarok: Valkryie Hero
boardgame.description:
Additional hero (Valkyrie) expansion with high quality miniature and hero board, including special rules.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Portals Card Game
boardgame.description:
Portals is a fun and strategic card game where you can create your own deck to battle your friends.

In Portals you battle against each other with 3 pre-chosen Champion cards to breach your opponents Stronghold represented by Breach Points. You can lower your opponent's Breach Points by battling his Champions and by opening Portals that can transfer you to other realms!
But beware, Champions can get stronger during the game, so watch your back!

Portals is a TCG where you create your own deck to play. Choose your 3 Champions to build your deck around, take the mutual Portal cards and place them in three piles between you and your opponent. You start with 4 cards in your hand. During your turn, you can play as many cards as you like and you may use every Champion for their attack and effect once, if you pay their Stamina cost. If a certain condition of your Champion is met, it gets empowered! This can change their stats and/or its effect. But watch out! Your Champions Breach points go up as well. So, if they get defeated you lose that many more.

Big part of the game is opening Portals. Every Portal has a specific cost. By gathering enough allies from your deck in the corresponding zone, you can open the Portals and send them through to gain different effects and breach your enemy's Stronghold.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Horseless Carriage
boardgame.description:
"This year, we want the best, or nothing at all. We don't want tradition. We want to live in the present, and the only history that is worth a tinker's damn is the history we make today." The famous founder is standing in front of his team giving a motivational speech. "You all know our first customer was a lunatic, and the second had a death wish. So they bought our brakeless bangers. So there were a few accidents. But the only mistake is the one from which we learn nothing. This year, customers demand safety. Of course, active safety features include rapid acceleration for safe overtaking! I know it will be hard to add the new motorblock section to the factory, but before you say you cannot do something, try it! To every engineer, every planner, every mechanic, and every salesperson in this great company I say: If I can dream it, you can do it!"

Horseless Carriage is a game about the dawn of the automobile, a time when cars were invented, and no one quite knew yet what this new contraption would look like and what features would be essential. Early cars sometimes used levers or pedals to steer and a wheel to accelerate. Brakes were not always seen as essential, but sometimes an outside spot to take along an onboard mechanic was. This early, super innovative period occurs in the development of many new product categories. Players are cast as aspiring industrialists trying to find out what features the public will value when buying these new, expensive, and utterly unfamiliar horseless carriages.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Circle of the Dragon
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Become an actual dragon in a dungeon with this Druid Circle for DND 5E!

Druids of the Circle of the Dragon devote themselves to the natural balance of all dragons, good and evil. Some worship beings such as Bahamut or Tiamat in a quest to gain divine ascension and draconic power. Whatever their motives, these druids carry a flaming passion and extraordinary pride.

This product includes:

- The #1 most upvoted Druid subclass on Reddit updated for Fizban's Treasury of Dragons
- Stats for the Druidic Dragon, a powerful and elusive new Wild Shape option

boardgame.description: A Mörk Borg hexcrawl inspired by The Hills Have Eyes.

boardgame.name: The Scoundrels Guild and Their Magic Crabs
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Come explore the secret hideout of a guild of treacherous warriors and wizards, each ready to get rid of the other in order to seize control!

A dungeon for DURF, a game by Emiel Boven.

boardgame.name: The Collector
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

The Collector is a playbook for the fantastic Wanderhome tabletop role-playing game. Wanderhome is a game about how we heal our traumas. This playbook explores the burdens of carrying a trauma, your own and others', while working toward healing.

When the war was over, some things did change. For example, recently, you discovered that you have inherited your late uncle’s Antiques Shoppe. You also discovered that many of the items he had knowingly sold were cursed and haunted, with dark and brooding traumas that infect their bearers. Your uncle dispersed them into the world. Now you try to undo that work, bringing them all back to the Shoppe’s vault, and locking them away where they can do no more harm, until they heal.

You are alive. Your care is atoning, shouldering, and determined.

A fore-warning, that this playbook heavily explores the carrying of Trauma within this game, and how much one can carry until it is healed.

boardgame.name: The Black Stallion Manor Massacre
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

On a stormy night, the party distinguishes spires over the crown of the dark pines, shelter !

They found The Black Stallion Manor, once renowned stables where boys and girls from all over the country came to be trained in the delicate art of horse mastery.

But those days are gone, and a shadow lurks in the vast tree-filled park.

The Black Stallion Manor Massacre is a Mörk Borg compatible adventure site, created for the Slasher Jam.

boardgame.name: Eagles over Europe
boardgame.description:
Recreate the Air War over the European theater of World War II as part of the epic clash between the Allies and Germans in some of the most historic battles of World War II, during the years 1941-1945.
Eagles Over Europe is a historical boardgame where players take the roles of US Army Airforce and the RAF (including the Polish pilots, of course!) to participate in WWII's most famous battles, including Omaha Beach, Pegasus Bridge, Operation Cobra, and the Ardennes (Battle of the Bulge). You'll also deal with the bombing campaign, as Mustangs and Thunderbolts try to protect the B-17s from hordes of Luftwaffe fighters.
Eagles Over Europe includes over 15 battle scenarios, all fought out on a huge, 140 cm x 100 cm game board (55" x 39"). Each scenario recreates the historical objectives of the two sides, and includes special events that impacted the battle's outcome.
Eagles Over Europe is designed to be easy-entry, but the game mechanics require strategic card play and finding skillful combinations between the dice, the symbols on the cards, and pilot abilities. In addition to the huge gameboard, Eagles over Europe includes detailed airplane miniatures, beautifully illustrated Combat cards, Scenario, Event and Pilot cards. Special Terrain tiles and Custom dice complete the "wow" people will feel when they open the box.
Those familiar with the "303 Squadron" game will recognize the core game mechanics but enjoy additions like Flak, RADAR, ground attack, and many more. But you don't have to have 303 Squadron to play Eagles Over Europe-- it is a totally free-standing game.
Eagles Over Europe is designed as a co-operative game for 1 - 4 players. The average game length is between 60 and 90 minutes. Each scenario includes innovative and clever mechanics, dynamic gameplay, and startling surprises...all "normal" for Eagles Over Europe!

boardgame.name: BattleTech: Touring the Stars – Brownsville
boardgame.description:
Now a lifeless, dead planet, Brownsville was once a vibrant and discreet supplier of atmospheric processors and inexpensive water filters before the Amaris Coup. But political and diplomatic mistakes would turn the unassuming planet into another casualty of the Star League Civil War and early Succession Wars. Brownsville's demise sealed the fate of dozens of other worlds.

Touring the Stars volumes consist of a color cover depicting an orbital view of the subject planet, a short history section, a small number of RPG tracks tailored to the planet, a rules annex detailing optional rules for games and scenarios set on the planet, a color world map and a hexed Battleforce 2 map. Each volume averages between 15 and 19 pages in total.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat
BattleTech: A Time of War – The BattleTech RPG

boardgame.name: BattleTech: Touring the Stars – Bob
boardgame.description:
It is a shadow world of dark woods and darker rivers, and so was it named--Dunklewälderdunkleflüsseschattenwelt. Alien predators roam the land, seas and air, named for creatures of folklore, while survivors of the once proud settlements eke out an meager existence. Dunklewälderdunkleflüsseschattenwelt suffered during the Succession Wars as many planets of the Inner Sphere did, but as detailed in Touring the Stars: Bob, the beginning of the end was unwittingly initiated by a vote to change the planet's name...

boardgame.name: Dangerous Mining
boardgame.description:
Dangerous Mining is a micro game consisting of 18 action cards to mine gems.
On your turn, you put one of the four cards on the display into your hand and plays a card from your hand.
Cards have the abilities to draw gems, play another action card, or discard an opponent's gems.
The game ends when a player get 20 / 18 / 16 (2p / 3p / 4p) points of gems, or the pile of gems runs out.
The player with the highest points of gems wins the game.

boardgame.name: Battletech: Touring the Stars – Promised Land
boardgame.description:
Promised Land was not exactly as the colonization brochures described, but was settled nevertheless. A chance encounter during the early Star League saved the planet from abandonment, and the struggling colony remained. Long a border waystation between the Lyran Commonwealth and the Free Worlds League, Promised Land's history is the story of overcoming the challenges of this strange world and thriving in its unique environment.

boardgame.name: Battletech: Touring the Stars – Inglesmond
boardgame.description:
A curious, albeit devastated, survivor of the First Succession War, Inglesmond was once a shining jewel of the Terran Hegemony. Though Inglesmond is now a planetary nature preserve in the Republic of the Sphere, it could easily be reinhabited and once again rejoin the Inner Sphere. Learn about the planet's unique climate and equatorial-spanning ice belt, tribal survivor communities and salvage operations gone awry.

boardgame.name: Battletech: Touring the Stars – McEvedy's Folly
boardgame.description:
McEvedy's Folly--a world where mad science ran rampant. In the grip of an ice age in the final years of the Star League, the planet once known as "Project SAGITARIUS UMBRELLA" was of little interest to anyone, save for brilliant xenobiologist Alpheus McEvedy. Under the aegis of terraforming, McEvedy played god with the primitive fauna, using them as vehicles to recreate long extinct species from across the Inner Sphere--as well as other rumored abominations. McEvedy and his team were eventually abandoned as the Star League fell, and the planet was lost for centuries--while only the legend of McEvedy's Folly remained.

Drawn by rumors of hidden Throline Desert caves caches filled with looted valuables, the world became infamous for being the home of Redjack Ryan and his dreaded capital of Raider's Roost.

However, recovery of the Helm Memory Core brought new importance to Ionus as the Free Worlds League's premier WarShip producer. A lucky survivor of the Word's Jihad, today Ionus's advanced shipyards remain a tempting target for any world-be conqueror.

boardgame.description:
Once an exotic and beautiful planet known for its large, naturally-occurring crystalline formations, Tyrfing was a provincial capital for the defunct Terran Hegemony. Savaged by the Star League Civil War, Tyrfing was damaged beyond repair by a five-way battle between all of the Great Houses during the early Succession Wars. Descending into a dangerous, mutated, feral wasteland, Tyrfing fell off the map. Left to rot, the world is still home to primitive human cultures struggling to survive their deadly world.

boardgame.name: Dumb Luck: The Lottery Game
boardgame.description:
Players are given chips and a lottery ticket on which they mark 6 numbers (out of 44). From the starting field, they travel through the American states and are allowed to move one step at a time when one of their 6 numbers is drawn. Events (chip win, chip loss) are triggered on some of the spaces reached. If all 6 numbers were drawn by a player, that player is allowed to go 6 more steps. Then all players have to buy a new lottery ticket and the procedure starts again. The first player to reach the target field with at least 20 chips wins the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Battletech: Touring the Stars – Jardine
boardgame.description:
Once a world of vibrant forests and exotic wildlife, Jardine’s loss in the early Succession Wars nearly erased it entirely from the annals of history. Rediscovered on the eve of the Word of Blake Jihad, its centuries-long isolation revealed one of the greatest secrets in ComStar’s dark past: the Hidden Worlds! Scoured by its own Guardians, the birthworld of the Manei Domini now lies under the shroud of endless smoke, its ruins a mute testament to the legacy of its fallen masters.

The dark history of this tortured world both resonates with, and haunts those drawn to it from across the stars. Iron Land is a planet where you can check out any time you like, but never leave.

boardgame.description: Bello the little dog immediately takes every child to his heart. The wooden dog figure is great for free play. The six finger games with rhymes around Bello motivate to imitate and speak and thus promote language development. The twelve domino cards also make a picture story that encourages storytelling.

boardgame.name: Battletech: Touring the Stars – Wynn's Roost
boardgame.description:
While the Outworlds Alliance shrunk on ComStar’s maps for two hundred years, not all of disappearing worlds died. The “Outworlds Wastes” also included secessionists, would-be pocket imperial capitals, abandoned worlds, pirate havens, pirates’ victims, and imagined sanctuaries from the bloody Succession Wars. Wynn’s Roost was one such world, alternately seceding from the defenseless Outworlds, attempting to build an interstellar nation, being abandoned by collapsing civilization, and suffering pirates’ depredations. The sulfurous world has outlasted its pirate tormentors, rebuilt its industrial base, and hosts a growing population that is now reaching out to the stars. It is a glimpse of the potential of the modern Periphery.

When the first waves of explorers and settlers departed Terra for the great black ocean, not all looked to the future—some longed for the traditional values of the past. One such group made their new home on Old Kentucky, a world near the heart of humanity which has persevered through centuries of abandonment, conflict and conquest.
Touring the Stars: Old Kentucky details this hot, rugged world, its proud history, and its native "sasquatch" primates.

The two thousand worlds of human space often claim to have some incredible beauty spot that is unrivaled by any other world. Some worlds claim to be the most beautiful entire world known to humanity. This freakish accident of planetology has thrilled tourists, earned a title as champion party planet, and avoided most wars for centuries until the Word of Blake arrived.

boardgame.description:
The players move along a route by rolling the dice and have to solve tasks on event fields and mostly drink a beer. The first player to reach field 30 alive is the winner.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Memorace: Descoperă Terra
Memorace: Meghökkentő rekordok
boardgame.description:
One minute is not the world, right? Do you think so even if you have even less time to memorize every detail of an image? Memorace board game amusingly develops not only memory but also general knowledge and literacy. Learning becomes a captivating experience with its tasteful illustrations. How good is your memory?

Learn about the Earth’s most prominent natural phenomena and man-made records in the Memorace Astonishing Records.

You can play Memorace alone or with more people.

Draw a card and put it in front of you!
Turn the clock over and try to memorize as many details as possible before the sand drips off - it’s about 10 seconds.
Throw the dice!
If you rolled 1, you must answer the thought-provoking puzzle on the front panel. Look at the picture and calculate or deduce correctly!
If you did not roll 1, turn the card over and answer the question on the back next to the rolled number. These will put your memory to the test, but if you watch well, you will know the answer for sure!


There’s no reason to get frustrated even if you didn’t know the answer, turn the card over and find the solution! However, if you answered correctly, you can keep the card - congratulations, you already have a point!
Who will collect the most cards? Can you break your own record?

boardgame.name: City of Flesh
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb:

Nagara is old, the city is dying, and you are the only one who can ward off the Doom.

City of Flesh is a tarot-based roleplay game where you play one of the Midwives, a person imbued with primordial energy, tasked with staving off the end of the world as you know it. Together with your fellow players and GM, you create the city of Nagara and its unique locations using a tarot deck. Each session your characters inch ever closer to a Doom they’re working tirelessly to prevent, but must inevitably face as the chronicle ends.

The game has the dark horror feeling of a dungeon crawl, while focusing on mechanics that drive in-game drama and push personal stories. You’ll get embroiled in the various wars raging between guilds in the city and try to secure a bit of personal peace, before all your efforts crumble around you. You’ll strive to survive in a city that is literally trying to eat you, and siphon off its power to keep the ones you love safe.

City of Flesh takes inspiration from grimdark fantasy combining it with a feminine aesthetic to create an immersive gore-splattered roleplay experience where you delve into the dreams of a sleeping colossus and tear through fleshy reality to make your own fate.

This expansion give the military aspect of the game a complete new approach. It can be used for all three volumes.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Operation Barbarossa Army Group Center
boardgame.description:
It is June 1941. The Third Reich embarks upon the greatest military campaign of all time. The Wehrmacht attacks across an 1800 mile front, 3.8 million men, 3350 tanks, 3000 aircraft, and 23,000 artillery pieces.
Now, as a tactical commander in the most significant campaign of the 20th century, it is up to you to win your battles, and shape the world, before it's too late!
(This is a Combat Boots game. Each unit represents a squad, individual gun, tank, or aircraft. Each space is 50 meters across, and each turn is approximately 5 minutes long. Best played face-to-face, but the game includes provisions for solitaire play)

listing.notes: Title: peration Barbarossa Army Group Center Publisher: GMT Games Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Age of Steam Expansion: Double Base USA / Pacific Electric
boardgame.description:
The Age of Steam Con 2021 Map Set contains two new maps.

Double Base USA
This map is the first to use two copies of Age of Steam. The map is a two-piece poster that is assembled to create a gigantic map. Players start their networks from the east coast and expand westward. Government land grants in the West help players build more track and get more deliveries. Track build limits double in later turns. Players can get up to a 12 Locomotive.

Pacific Electric
Players build a network out of Los Angeles into the surrounding cities using Power Plants to increase the length of deliveries on their electric rail network. This map shares a common core with Age of Steam: Kansas City Interurban and adds its own unique twists and geography. The Express action allows players to deliver through a City matching the good color. The Engineer action allows players to build on rough terrain hexes. The map size is small and promotes a lot of player interaction.

boardgame.name: World Series Computerized Baseball
boardgame.description:
Batter up! Bases are loaded - there are two outs and full count on the batter - can he outwit the pitcher and drive in the winning run?
Two players or two opposing teams plan their pitching and batting strategy and feed their plays into the Analog Computer. The Computer "Read Out" gives the resulting plays instantly. The Computerized Play Chart guides the next action play - all in accordance with Official Baseball rules.
All of the Challenge-Strategy-Suspense of live Baseball-from base hits to homeruns! Planned Strategy keeps the game moving for 9 or more action-packed innings.

boardgame.name: Sounds of Fun: Disney's Beauty and the Beast
boardgame.description:
Actual character voices and realistic sound effects bring Beauty and the Beast to life as you make your move in the 3-D palace ballroom and courtyard.

An enchantress has turned the Prince into a Beast, and all his servants into Enchanted Objects. Use your memory to help bell break the spell-and make them all human again. The player that reveals the Prince wins the game.

Players press the center button on the Sound Randomizer board, following the instructions given. The aim of the game is to collect 5 Enchanted Objects chips. which are needed to turn the Beast Human. Players have 5 chances to turn the beast human. The player who turns over the correct magic rose square, wins the game.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: Beauty and the Beast

boardgame.name: Heirs to Heresy: The Fall of the Knights Templar
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

[Heirs to Heresy is a] game of powerful Knights Templar escaping from a cruel world that has branded them heretics.
...
You are one of the thirty Knights Templar who awoke on Friday, 13 October 1307, only to find themselves wanted criminals and branded heretics by the King of France. Abandoned by the Vatican and sent away early in the morning, you must leave Paris on a day of reckoning and try to find your way across a dark, mythic Europe to a mystical utopia where you can rebuild!

Heirs to Heresy starts as a historical-fantasy roleplaying game, but is heavily influenced by Gnosticism, European Folklore, esotericism, and the myths and legends that surround the Templars. The game will ask you to craft the secrets of the Templar treasure, the enemies, and mysteries they will face, as your Knights undertake a mystical journey to the center of themselves along the road to Avallonis.

The mechanics are a blend of narrative, storytelling rules, and classic adventure-gaming inspired roleplaying rules that work to create rich aspect-driven characters. As Templar Knights, your skill at arms is unquestionable, but it is the potential access to gnostic spells, unique powers, or intensely powerful faith sets you apart from your compatriots.

Can you tap into your potential, guarding the mysterious Templar treasure on this last quest you will take for the order and find the answer to the burning question: are the Templars Heirs to Heresy?

boardgame.name: Gran Meccanismo: Clockpunk Roleplaying in Da Vinci's Florence
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




Publisher's blurb:

It could have been so different. Who knows, if Niccolo Machiavelli, military commissioner of the Republic of Florence, had not truly understood the scale of Leonardo da Vinci's genius, he might simply have wasted his time painting portraits of women and doodling. Instead, Florence's screwcopters, gun-turtles and organ-guns make it secure against the armies of the Pope, Milan, and the French, and a haven for radical thinkers, artists, and other inventors inspired by his example. Of course, though, success breeds jealousy amongst the city states of Renaissance Italy and beyond. The city's winding alleys and cobbled squares swarm with sinister Venetian spies, sour-faced priests bearing secret Papal instructions, Milanese mercenaries hoping to earn the king's ransom the Sforzas have promised for da Vinci's secrets and even emissaries from France, England and the Ottoman Empire… Exciting times, but dangerous ones, too.

What if all da Vinci's inventions had worked as he had hoped? What if they had been enthusiastically adopted and that their successes had sparked a different kind of industrial revolution? Gran Meccanismo is a roleplaying game of swashbuckling swordplay as an army of robot knights marches past on their way to the Vatican. Players are patricians, mercenaries, spies, and inventors amidst a Renaissance Italy where they may find themselves crossing wits with Machiavelli, avoiding the dangerous charms of Lucretia Borgia, and hearing Christopher Columbus tell you about the new world he has discovered...

boardgame.name: Book of Nod
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Book of Nod is not designed to be the definitive book on the nature of vampires and their founder, Caine. There are no game mechanics within.

The reason behind this is that The Book of Nod is meant to be 100 percent setting material.

Ideally, Storytellers will use The Book of Nod as a prop in either their Mind's Eye Theatre: Vampire The Masquerade game or their Vampire: The Masquerade chronicles.

boardgame.name: Dreamy Paws
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

You are the owner of an intergalactic sanctuary, a haven for all lost and wayward creatures. All you want is foreach creature to receive the love and attention it requires. Advertising the creatures you rescue on Spacebook isthe best way to find their forever homes, and your creative descriptions draw many prospective patrons into thesanctuary.

boardgame.name: Silent Ships
boardgame.description:
A naval-themed card game for 2 players. It is a card battler that borrows mechanics from war games by making units move around the board. Instead of a mana system, players can play ships for free but need to discard cards to move them around the board. Islands can be captured to increase one's draw power, but these are out of the way and come at the cost of tempo. Additionally, as ships begin to sink, the deck gradually thins, and eventually draw power becomes irrelevant in the end game.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Dark Highway
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The call you the Gentleman Bandit, because no one knew your name.

Now they call you nothing, lest they conjure you from the Grim Old Grave: you, your ossa, your white pate, your pale soft parts eaten complete, leaving only the hardest bits - the human pits; your marrow now a poison - the armature for your armament all a-rattle; every sinew in your Pen-and-Pistol hand a member but still able, still willing, still here, never still or dead or gone, just waiting for their Coward's call, just waiting to ride again.

boardgame.name: Ghostly Gratitude
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

On a crisp clear night at the beginning of fall, you build a bonfire, grab a steaming mug of something sweet & sit bundled up before the cozy fire, listening to the crackling wood & watching the dancing flames.

boardgame.name: Irukandji
boardgame.description:
Irukandji is the first game in the SNACKBOX Mini Game Series.

You have swum a long way out, and it is now time to head home. Race back to the beach without coming across one of the most venomous jellyfish in the world: the Irukandji.

Irukandji is a game of tile laying and tile playing. Swim well, use the conditions, and watch out for the Irukandji.

Be the first player to get to +2 (points) on the scorecard, by scoring each swim to The Beach.

Take turns moving from tile to tile, dealing with the ocean conditions as you go while trying to avoid the hidden dangers. Aim to get back to The Beach first, and collect the Beach Ball token, if you can.

—description form the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: SNACKBOX Mini Game Series – Collection One

boardgame.name: Skate Park
boardgame.description:
Skate Park is the second game in the SNACKBOX Mini Game Series.

The competition is ready to start. Can you prove you’re the best skater in the park?

Execute your best tricks over a series of obstacles to claim the title. Flip, grind, and find air to win each challenge
...without hitting concrete.

A flipping good game of trick making and tile taking. Lay down your moves, land well, and dominate the competition.

Win the most Obstacle Tiles to prove you are the best skater in the park. Play tricks and execute them with successful rolls to win each Obstacle Tile. Each trick has a different winning value, cost, and percentage of success. Choose wisely, or hit the concrete.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: SNACKBOX Mini Game Series – Collection One

boardgame.name: Chimichangas and Tacos
boardgame.description:
Chimichangas and Tacos is the third game in the SNACKBOX Mini Game Series.

So let's not burrito round the bush. You think this is nacho game? Let's taco bout it.

This game is about making tasty Tacos, Taquitos, Nachos, Quesidillas, Enchiladas, Burritos, and of course...Chimichangas!

Grab chips to reveal your ingredients, then fill, wrap, fry, and top your way to the most delicious meals on the menu.

Complete the tastiest meals and score the highest number of points (and Tacos), over several rounds.

Pick ‘chips’ from a pile and stack the ingredients to make meals (using the Recipes). Make sure you complete your meals, as it will cost you. Add some tasty condiments if you want to enhance the flavor!

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: SNACKBOX Mini Game Series – Collection One

boardgame.name: Slingshot
boardgame.description:
Slingshot is the fourth game in the SNACKBOX Mini Game Series.

The annual Kylor System race has arrived. Only the finest pilots have dared to enter. But, who is the best racer in the Galaxy?

Strap in and work your way through the system. Complete each Planet’s orbital requirements and slingshot to victory!

A supersonic dice game of planet-hopping rocket racing. Match orbitals, spend bounty, and slingshot to victory.

Be the first Rocket Racer to pass the last Planet (finish line) in the system.

Complete Flight Sequences by rolling dice and matching Icons, to pass each Planet. First roll combinations can gain you Crystals, and abilities can help slingshot you to victory.

Look out for Asteroids if they are in play.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: SNACKBOX Mini Game Series – Collection One

boardgame.name: Lords of Ragnarok: Terrain Expansion
boardgame.description:
The terrain expansion adds high quality models of temples, settlements and mythical realms. This expansion is purely cosmetic, and the realm + settlment models only emphasize the different locations printed on the game board.

Contains:

7 temple models (replaces the standees from the core box)
6 realm models
11 settlement models



–description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Lords of Ragnarok: Enhanced Runes
boardgame.description: Replace your core box cardboard runes and forges with premium acrylic runes (stylized as bone).

boardgame.name: Divinus: Die Büchse der Pandora
Divinus: Pandora's Box
boardgame.description:
The Pandora's Box Expansion contains unlocked Stretch Goals from the Divinus Gamefound campaign and is included with every pledge.

Contains:

extra components for Eternal mode
5 extra miniatures
5 extra Myth scenarios
10 new god cards
15 new quest cards
20 new artifacts


–description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Road Trippin: After Dark Expansion Pack
boardgame.description: 300+ Adult Only Phrases on cards to use with the Road Tripping board game. Definitely not for kids!

listing.notes: Title: Road Trippin: After Dark Expansion Pack Publisher: Guilt Free Gaming Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Shadows of Brimstone: Challenge Pack #1 – Bound by Darkness
boardgame.description:
Includes:
- Heretic Preacher - Large Enemy Record Sheet
- Resin Heretic Preacher Miniature
- Rulesheet with Bound by Darkness Mission
- 30 Game Cards

Recommended for use with the following products: Swamps of Death, Scourge Rats and Hell Vermin Enemy Packs, Hellfire Succubi Mission Pack, and the Forest of the Dead Otherworld.

Holy preachers are renowned for their devotion and faith, leading the charge to keep evil at bay. When one of these men of the cloth is corrupted by the ruinous powers, his fall from grace plummets to depths far deeper and more twisted than could be imagined. Heretic Preachers fight with a fanatical zeal, wielding Dark Sermons to unleash hellfire and damnation on any that cross their hellbound path to becoming one with the Darkness.
Challenge Pack #1 - Bound by Darkness is themed for facing off against a corrupted Heretic Preacher and his legions of demonic and beastly minions that all use the Bound by Darkness Enemy Trait card. Casting powerful Dark Sermons at the Heroes, and wielding a devastating Hellfire Shotgun, the Heretic Preacher and his hordes will put your Heroes to the test!
A Challenge Pack is a new themed set of cards with a terrifying new Enemy and a nightmarish new Mission designed to give the Heroes an extra challenge. These cards are all used together for the included Mission; but can also be added to your card decks to increase the challenge across your normal games of Shadows of Brimstone as well. Many of these new cards are marked with a Challenge Icon, to be easily identified as extra dangerous.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Shadows of Brimstone: City of the Ancients
Shadows of Brimstone: City of the Ancients (Revised Edition)
Shadows of Brimstone: Swamps of Death
Shadows of Brimstone: Swamps of Death (Revised Edition)

boardgame.name: Memorace: Ismerkedjünk a betűkkel!
boardgame.description:
One minute is not the world, right? Do you think so even if you have even less time to memorize every detail of an image? Memorace board game entertainingly develops not only memory but also general knowledge and literacy. Learning becomes a captivating experience with its tasteful illustrations. How good is your memory?

Wander through the wonderful landscapes of Romania and get to know the culture!

You can play Memorace alone, or with more people.

Draw a card and put it in front of you!
Turn the clock over and try to memorize as many details as possible before the sand drips - it’s about 10 seconds.
Throw the dice!
If you rolled 1, you must answer the thought-provoking puzzle on the front panel. Look at the picture and calculate or deduce correctly!
If you did not roll 1, turn the card over and answer the question on the back next to the rolled number. These will put your memory to the test, but if you watch well, you will know the answer for sure!


There’s no reason to get frustrated even if you didn’t know the answer, turn the card over and find the solution! However, if you answered correctly, you can keep the card - congratulations, you already have a point!
Who will collect the most cards? Can you break your own record?

boardgame.name: Silk: Shin Ookami Promo
boardgame.description:
The first edition of Bitoku contains 2 promo's: one for Bitoku itself and a second one for Silk.

It's an improvement tile that will replace one of the original ones, as you can still only have 4 in a game.

Rules:

Each time the ookami is able to send three or more silkworms to her cave in the same move, the player whose turn it is may decide, in addition, to place a silkworm of their own color on the Shin Ookami tile, either from their reserve or from the Ookami’s den.

At the end of the game, during the final scoring, the player with the most silkworms on the Shin Ookami will get 5 points +1 additional point for each silkworm of their color on that tile.

If a player has no silkworms left in their reserve, they can use the “Raise a Silkworm” action to get a silkworm back from the Shin Ookami tile and return it to their own reserve (just like silkworms are rescued from the Ookami’s den).

listing.notes: Payment with Paypal or European Bank transfer (IBAN)

Since this was included on the main punchboards for Bitoku, the 2 tiles for this promo (one being the promo tile itself and the other containing a QR code link to the rules) have been removed from the punchboard, but are brand new and unused.
Postage to the UK is £1. Please contact me for overseas shipping.

Shipping and handling via USPS Priority Mail or USPS First Class Parcel Service.
Payment via PayPal only.
Comes from smoke free home.
Shipping will be $4, for the 2 tiles to be shipped well protected in a padded bubble mailer.

boardgame.name: Abszolút elfelejtett szavak
boardgame.description:
In this game you will find 880 absolute, funny, weird, slightly forgotten and unusual words and 110 non-everyday proverbs.
All you have to do is explain to the other players what they mean - whoever convinces most people of their truth wins!

Convince most people that you are right about what these words mean and if that happens you have a case to win!

boardgame.name: Gutenberg: Yolande & Johannes Promo Characters
boardgame.description:
A set of 2 promo tiles that was first given to everybody whom bought the game at Spiel 2021 in Essen.

It contains 2 extra character tiles:

Yolande Bonhomme: You only play 5 guilders for every type of letter block you buy.

Johannes Oporinus: You start the game with 2 personal patronage cards (chosen out of 4) which you can fulfill as your patronage action.

listing.notes:
Only the tiles, which are unpunched + a copy of the english rules (no stickers)
Shipping costs (shipped as a letter, no tracking nor insurance included): worldwide: €2,50 Contact me for other shipping options or combined shipping

boardgame.name: Historia: Libro delle Avventure
boardgame.description:
User Summary:
Adventures for Historia Dark Fantasy Renaissance Setting

boardgame.name: The Siege of Runedar: Mercenaries Promo Cards
boardgame.description:
This promo was first given out to everybody whom bought The Siege of Runedar at Spiel 2021 in Essen.

It adds 5 mercenary cards to the 5 from the base game and therefore will give you more possibilities to defend the castle.

The abilities of these new mercenaries are: ignore all orc cards in your hand, remove up to 5 rubble pieces from the tunnel, place all remaining resources on an upgrade card, do a long-range attack with 5 dice & do a close-range attack with 5 dice.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Brancalonia - Guerre Feudali
boardgame.description:
User Summary:
Sourcebook and scenario for Brancalonia setting

boardgame.name: Sine Requie Anno XIII: Gladiatori
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:
Bentornati tra le rugginose mura di metallo del Soviet.
Bentornati tra l'acre fumo nero delle biomacchine, e tra l'olio bollente dei Moduli Biomeccanici che straziano e sostituiscono la carne e le ossa del popolo russo.

English translation:
Welcome back to the rusty metal walls of the Soviet.
Welcome back to the acrid black smoke of the biomachines, and the boiling oil of the Biomechanical Modules that tear apart and replace the flesh and bones of the Russian people.

boardgame.name: L'Ultima Torcia - Set del Master
boardgame.description:
User summary:
Boxed set including new scenarios, new rules and the DM's screen

boardgame.name: The Cava Hack -Cuori Impuri
boardgame.description:
User Summary:
Modern fantasy hack'n'slash RPG inspired by metroidvania videogames

boardgame.name: Battletech: Recognition Guide – IlClan Volume 20
boardgame.description:
The march of technology across BattleTech’s eras is relentless—but some BattleMech designs never die. Each installment of this PDF-only series not only includes a brand new BattleMech or OmniMech, but also details Classic ’Mech designs from both the Inner Sphere and the Clans, now fully rebuilt with Dark Age technology (3085 and beyond).

Volume 20 Includes Rules and Record Sheets for:

Hellion T/D/E/F/P
Shadow Hawk IIC/IIC 2/IIC 10/IIC 11
Longbow LGB-0H/0W2/8C/10C/10K/14Q/14V
Warhawk (Masakari) T/F/G/I/L
Mastodon Prime/A/B/C/D
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Battletech: Touring the Stars – Regis Roost
boardgame.description:
Ringers and Roosters. Two separate cultures living very different lives, one in the rings of the verdant planet of Regis Roost, the other at the bottom of that world’s gravity well. Two separate governing philosophies, one as an extended family with corporate laws, and the other a pseudo-democracy subverted for decades by external interests. Two very different civilizations living on one world in the Taurian Concordat—what could possibly go wrong?

Touring the Stars volumes consist of a color cover depicting an orbital view of the subject planet, a short history section, a small number of RPG tracks tailored to the planet, a rules annex detailing optional rules for games and scenarios set on the planet, a color world map and a hexed Battleforce 2 map. Each volume averages between 15 and 19 pages in total.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat
BattleTech: A Time of War – The BattleTech RPG

boardgame.name: BattleTech: Touring the Stars – Hall
boardgame.description:
War has ravaged nearly all of the Inner Sphere’s core planets, and Hall is no exception. Caught between the conquests of empires and the ambitions of warlords, the world’s history is as harsh as its unforgiving deserts, howling canyons and shifting sands. Hall has been at the crossroads of some of mankind’s most brutal wars, conflicts which have left centuries of secrets ready to snare the unready and tempt the unwise.

Touring the Stars volumes consist of a color cover depicting an orbital view of the subject planet, a short history section, a small number of RPG tracks tailored to the planet, a rules annex detailing optional rules for games and scenarios set on the planet, a color world map and a hexed Battleforce 2 map. Each volume averages between 15 and 19 pages in total.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat
BattleTech: A Time of War – The BattleTech RPG

boardgame.name: High Noon: Bonnie Beecher and the Bandero Blondes
boardgame.description:
In a world of objectified and enslaved women, these former-harlots-turned-liberated-ladies roam the caravan trails, exacting vengeance and causing havoc on men across Saratoga making a name for themselves as the widow-making Bandero Blondes.

The Bandero Blondes are a posse that has the full monte of firearms: pistols, rifles, and shotguns. Their bordello fortress sports a balcony for taking advantageous shots from an elevated position.

Contents:

4 Miniatures (Bonnie Beecher, Miranda, Bandero Blonde 1, Bandero Blonde 2)
1 Starting tile (8×12 in Bordello tile)
34 Posse cards

boardgame.name: Yuru Camp x Cat & Chocolate
YuruCamp x Cat & Chocolate
ゆるキャ△ット＆チョコレート
boardgame.description: Yuru Camp x Cat & Chocolate is an anime-based version of storytelling game Cat & Chocolate. Based on the Yuru Camp theme, players will use items to solve problems while camping. The team that solves more problems wins.

boardgame.name: Seasons: Kairn the Destroyer Playmat
boardgame.description:
Seasons official playmat

Offered to selected winners of the 12 Seasons Tournament - World Series 2014.

Also offered at contests in 2014.

boardgame.name: OXtA Cube
オクタキューブ
boardgame.description:
A abstract game, each player has four cubes, OX+△，Each cube has different move rules. For example,+ can move forward, backward, left or right. Cubes can stack into a stack to move.

The box contains rules to play different games. For example, one of them is that the player who moves all the cubes to the opposite side wins the game.

boardgame.name: This is Your Captain Speaking
boardgame.description:
This is Your Captain Speaking launches you onto the deck of an interstellar spacecraft rife with cutthroat ambition. You might be boldly venturing across the galaxy in the pursuit of scientific discovery, but this is no sci-fi utopia. Everyone aboard this ship, from First Officer to Sewage Processor, has their eye on the coveted Captaincy. Will the beleaguered Captain hang on or will one of your scheming underlings manage to manoeuvre their way to the top?

In This is Your Captain Speaking, each player takes control of the fates of a range of crew members aboard the ship, attempting to get them onto 'away missions' where Commendations may be awarded - critical to success as a would-be Captain. Missions are dangerous, though - and depending on who it is that has influence on the right crew members at the right time, they could be fatal. Players jostle for the highest rank in each ship department, each of which confers powerful crew duties performed after each mission. Wrestle to the Captaincy, or sabotage your opponents in order to control the Bridge. This is Your Captain Speaking is the ultimate game in devious plans, shocking twists of fate and Captains starting from humble beginnings.

Each round consists of a series of 'missions' and 'crew duties' capped off with a 'starbase' phase. Depending on who is in charge of which department, crew characters are selected to participate in a mission - which could be lucrative or perilous...each character rolls on the encounter table to see just how bad of a time they had off-ship. Which planet Navigation chose for them will dramatically affect the outcome of each mission. Woven throughout every phase of the game are devious 'schemes' that players can action to manipulate the circumstances of the crew to their advantage.

After each mission is resolved (and any deceased crew members are removed and their underlings promoted), players then action the crew duties in order - with the highest-ranking character in each department wielding the powerful effects that round. Will they mitigate the impact of a mission, or take advantage of a crew member's injuries to promote their own. In each 'year', after two mission-duties cycles, the crew will stop off at a starbase to refuel (and for players to command control of more of the surviving crew...)

Players win by either having one of their controlled characters in the Captain's chair holding at least three commendations at the end of a 'year', or at the end of three years having scored the most points across their controlled crew.
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: Inside the Box Board Games LLP (ITB)

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Mau Mau Junior
Mau Mau: a la ferme
Mau Mau: Farmyard
boardgame.description:
What a beautiful day! All the farmyard animals want to play in the flower meadow, but players can only lead them there by placing cards with a matching animal or color. The player with the fewest animals at the end wins.

Player have 3 cards in their hand and 1 in the paddock. On their turn, the must try to add a card to the discard pile (meadow) by matching the color or animal on the card in the pile. If they can't, the player adds a card to their paddock pile and picks a new card to add to their hand.

The game ends when the draw pile is finished and no one can add a card to the meadow from their paddock.

The player with fewest animals in their paddock at the end of the game wins.

boardgame.name: Dead By Dawn
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

A submission to the 2021 Slash Jam. A One-Shot that can be completed in 1 or 2 sessions inspired by Sam Raimi's "Evil Dead II" (1987). This adventure utilizes monsters found in the core rulebook! If a monster doesn't have stats, they will be found there!

boardgame.name: Holy Items of the Church of the Two-Headed Basilisk
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

An entry into the Babalonian Jam for MÖRK BORG, it's table of d8 random Holy Items in the possession of the Church of the Two-Headed Basilisk to be looted or stolen by your players.

boardgame.name: Cultist Zombies
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Cultist zombies differ from regular zombies in multiple aspects, the main one being that they do not transmit the zombie virus, but rather, they are fragments of the tormented soul of a greater demon scattered in corpses. It includes:

- Lore for the zombies
- 7 new monsters fully ilustrated
- A table of random mutation for the zombies (or your players if they pray to the right entity)
- A dungeon! full of deadly traps scary monsters and super freaks

Dedicated to the iconic 1969 franchise although its name has been tainted by countless spin offs it will always be remembered for its contribution to horror, humor and complete neglect of animal life on set. (no goats were slaughtered in the production of this zine)

boardgame.name: Thrice Cursed
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Three cursed items that you can drop into random dungeons for your players to find! Inflict these powerful items upon your players, but know that they carry a heavy curse, spreading misery and despair for all.

boardgame.name: Utställningslokaler the Showroom
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

An endless dungeon generator of furniture stealing and being lost.

This contains simple rules to generate a theoretically infinite dungeon and populate it with loot and monsters and events.

Dungeon layout generator, 5 new monsters and events, and no leftover bolts and screws ( now that I think of it I should have added it too).

boardgame.name: A Mörkdrom on Borg Street
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

An encounter that can be dropped into any MB campaign/scenario whenever the PCs are resting.

boardgame.name: Bitcoinopoly
boardgame.description:
Bitcoinopoly is a highly strategic crypto-powered version of the Wall Street trading floor. Players take turns drawing and playing cards until someone collects three colour coded sets of crypto currencies and lays them out on the table.

Players pick up cards and attempt to collect 3 matching sets. The first play to do so wins. However, event cards can stop your efforts!

The game becomes increasingly intense as each player builds their crypto portfolio, as each player's crypto trading strategy becomes apparent. This is when you'll have to use all your strategic might. GOOD LUCK!

boardgame.name: Seasons: Demon of Argos Playmat
boardgame.description:
Seasons official playmat

Offered to selected winners of the 12 Seasons Tournament - World Series 2014.

Also offered at contests in 2014.

boardgame.name: Gare au putois!
Watch out for the skunk!
boardgame.description:
The skunk has scattered all of the animals! Find out where they are hiding sp you can match them up.

Get the animals out of their hiding place by imitating the sounds they make. Complete animal families by bringing them back to their homes. The game ends when all the families have found their homes. The player who has accumulated the most homes wins the game.

boardgame.name: Battletech: Touring the Stars – Tortuga Prime
boardgame.description:
On the pirate haven of Tortuga Prime, alliances can shift and power can exchange hands at a moment’s notice. An interstellar kleptocracy, Tortuga Prime’s only rule is simple: take what you need, and try to keep it. Will you further the centuries-old cycle of needless death and destruction—or put a stop to it once and for all?

Touring the Stars volumes consist of a color cover depicting an orbital view of the subject planet, a short history section, a small number of RPG tracks tailored to the planet, a rules annex detailing optional rules for games and scenarios set on the planet, a color world map and a hexed Battleforce 2 map. Each volume averages between 15 and 19 pages in total.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat
BattleTech: A Time of War – The BattleTech RPG

boardgame.name: Battletech: Touring the Stars – Sherwood
boardgame.description:
Founded with ecological sustainability in mind, the colonization of Sherwood seemed like a failure as soon as it began. But thanks to the strict control of a strong central government and a well-educated population, Sherwood pushed through the privations of the Star League era and became the “Green Gem” of the Outback.

Touring the Stars volumes consist of a color cover depicting an orbital view of the subject planet, a short history section, a small number of RPG tracks tailored to the planet, a rules annex detailing optional rules for games and scenarios set on the planet, a color world map and a hexed Battleforce 2 map. Each volume averages between 15 and 19 pages in total.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat
BattleTech: A Time of War – The BattleTech RPG

boardgame.name: Battletech: Touring the Stars – Herotitus
boardgame.description:
From oppressive occupation by pirates to religious domination by various sects, Herotitus knows what it means to suffer. New hope for the future is growing, thanks to the stability and protection from the resource-rich world’s deadly, unique native wildlife offered by the narrowed eye of the Fronc Reaches and their Colonial Marshals. But criminal elements remain in hiding, desperate to return to power, threatening the precarious peace.

Touring the Stars volumes consist of a color cover depicting an orbital view of the subject planet, a short history section, a small number of RPG tracks tailored to the planet, a rules annex detailing optional rules for games and scenarios set on the planet, a color world map and a hexed Battleforce 2 map. Each volume averages between 15 and 19 pages in total.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat
BattleTech: A Time of War – The BattleTech RPG

boardgame.name: Battletech: Touring the Stars – Stotzing
boardgame.description:
The Star League’s terraforming technology brought life to worlds struggling to survive, and wrought miracles on landscapes thought uninhabitable. But Stotzing is proof that even miracles can be undone by human hands, and not all those who seek to repair them are angels.

Touring the Stars volumes consist of a color cover depicting an orbital view of the subject planet, a short history section, a small number of RPG tracks tailored to the planet, a rules annex detailing optional rules for games and scenarios set on the planet, a color world map and a hexed Battleforce 2 map. Each volume averages between 15 and 19 pages in total.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat
BattleTech: A Time of War – The BattleTech RPG

boardgame.name: Battletech: Touring the Stars – Rigil Kentarus
boardgame.description:
Terra’s closest if not first colony, the binary planets of Rigil Kentarus and Riken Minor are just 4.3 light-years from Terra. Rigil Kentarus was settled by a mélange of Terran Alliance member-nations, some of which still leave their mark on the world (“Little America”), while others were wiped out by the Succession Wars, Jihad, and reconstruction. The twin worlds only recovered in the Republic of the Sphere, but generations-old refugee camps nurse hatred for the current government.

Touring the Stars volumes consist of a color cover depicting an orbital view of the subject planet, a short history section, a small number of RPG tracks tailored to the planet, a rules annex detailing optional rules for games and scenarios set on the planet, a color world map and a hexed Battleforce 2 map. Each volume averages between 15 and 19 pages in total.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat
BattleTech: A Time of War – The BattleTech RPG

boardgame.name: Battletech: Touring the Stars – Kaumberg
boardgame.description:
Nestled in the wide frontiers of Lyran space, Kaumberg is a pastoral world known mostly for its woodlands and little else. But just below the mundane surface lies a world of political intrigue, its fortunes and falls tied inextricably to those of the Commonwealth to whom its rulers serve. Collective masters of one of the region’s strongest independent defense forces, the barons of Kaumberg stand ever-ready to protect their world and its neighbors from any Periphery threat that comes their way—but only as long as their own internal intrigues don’t get in the way.

Touring the Stars volumes consist of a color cover depicting an orbital view of the subject planet, a short history section, a small number of RPG tracks tailored to the planet, a rules annex detailing optional rules for games and scenarios set on the planet, a color world map and a hexed Battleforce 2 map. Each volume averages between 15 and 19 pages in total.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat
BattleTech: A Time of War – The BattleTech RPG

boardgame.name: BattleTech: Touring the Stars – Braunschweig
boardgame.description:
Braunschweig is one of the jewels of the Hanseatic League. Combining pristine nature with highly developed cities, from orbit the world appears to be a paradise. On the ground, however, the luster tarnishes significantly. The natural abundance is rife with deadly native life, and civilization is stratified between the ultra-wealthy and the serfs who labor under their lash. Braunschweig is in fact a world of contrasts, where natural beauty meets industrial sterility, and luxurious comfort clashes with penurious servitude.

Touring the Stars volumes consist of a color cover depicting an orbital view of the subject planet, a short history section, a small number of RPG tracks tailored to the planet, a rules annex detailing optional rules for games and scenarios set on the planet, a color world map and a hexed Battleforce 2 map. Each volume averages between 15 and 19 pages in total.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat
BattleTech: A Time of War – The BattleTech RPG

boardgame.name: Battletech: Touring the Stars – Valencia
boardgame.description:
Among the isolated Castilian worlds is Valencia: a distant planet of turbulent, short seasons, and eerie purple-black foliage. Fresh water was abundant, terrestrial crops and animals thrived, and native plants and sea life were edible. The only thing that could disrupt this unusual paradise was, of course, humanity.

Small conflicts among the first settlers, the Castilians, disrupted the peace of Valencia. And then invaders—the “Umayyads”—attacked with never-before-seen giant, bipedal robots. A neighboring league of interstellar merchants, the Hansa, never allowed the Castilians and Umayyad invaders to find peace. The arrival of Clan Goliath Scorpion settled their conflict, and gave Valencia a central place in the Scorpions’ new Imperio.

Touring the Stars volumes consist of a color cover depicting an orbital view of the subject planet, a short history section, a small number of RPG tracks tailored to the planet, a rules annex detailing optional rules for games and scenarios set on the planet, a color world map and a hexed Battleforce 2 map. Each volume averages between 15 and 19 pages in total.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat
BattleTech: A Time of War – The BattleTech RPG

boardgame.name: BattleTech: Touring the Stars – Granada
boardgame.description:
Granada: called “The Pumpkin” by everyone but its inhabitants, this oblate planet is probably the fastest-spinning world settled by humanity. Like other worlds of the Nueva Castilian cluster, it is water-rich and very compatible with terrestrial life, allowing humans to thrive.

Granada has seen key events in Castilian history: the collapse of its original central government, the invasion of refugees from the Clan worlds, and the birth of the Umayyads. The Seekers of Clan Goliath Scorpion have delved into this history, answering burning questions of the Umayyads’ mysterious origins.

Touring the Stars volumes consist of a color cover depicting an orbital view of the subject planet, a short history section, a small number of RPG tracks tailored to the planet, a rules annex detailing optional rules for games and scenarios set on the planet, a color world map and a hexed Battleforce 2 map. Each volume averages between 15 and 19 pages in total.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat
BattleTech: A Time of War – The BattleTech RPG

boardgame.name: BattleTech: Touring the Stars – Gulf Breeze
boardgame.description:
From pirates to profiteers, and corrupt Mining Consortiums in between, Gulf Breeze has a thousand different ways to kill even veteran spacers. But with great danger comes great opportunity and Gulf Breeze has it by the metric ton. If you can survive the resource-rich world’s deadly and unique planetary challenges or avoid being spaced from a Wheeler station, a fortune awaits.

Touring the Stars volumes consist of a color cover depicting an orbital view of the subject planet, a short history section, a small number of RPG tracks tailored to the planet, a rules annex detailing optional rules for games and scenarios set on the planet, a color world map and a hexed Battleforce 2 map. Each volume averages between 15 and 19 pages in total.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat
BattleTech: A Time of War – The BattleTech RPG

boardgame.name: Battletech: Historical – Liberation of Terra vol 1
boardgame.description:
In 2766, decades of careful planning and manipulation finally culminated when Stefan Amaris wiped out the entire Cameron dynasty in a bloody coup. Rallying the might of the SLDF behind him, General Aleksandr Kerensky immediately attacked Amaris' Rim Worlds Republic, before turning his full fury against the Usurper's "Empire"? launching one of the greatest military campaigns in Inner Sphere history.

Historical: Liberation of Terra, Volume 1 describes the early years of the civil war that would ultimately bring about the final end of the first Star League. Covering the fighting from the coup itself to the bloody campaign for the Terran Hegemony, this book provides a hard look at the closing years of the Star League Era, and the fateful decisions that would eventually pave the way for centuries of Succession Wars to come.

Battletech Historicals series delves into the pivotal wars of the Inner Sphere’s thousand-year history, with important personalities, maps of individual attack waves and regiment listings, along with a campaign framework that allows players to enact every aspect of each of these important events.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat
BattleTech: A Time of War – The BattleTech RPG

boardgame.name: Battletech: Historical – Liberation of Terra vol 2
boardgame.description:
In 2777--after ten years of savage fighting in the Periphery--General Alaksandr Kerensky and the Star League Defense Force launched the final phase in the war against Stefan Amaris, the Usurper of the Star League. For two more years, the greatest army ever forged by humankind would wage a planetby-planet war for the heart of the League itself, ultimately landing on mankind's homeworld of Terra. As the single greatest campaign ever fought in human history, Operation LIBERATION would change the fate of generations to come.

Historical: Liberation of Terra, Volume 2 describes the final years of the civil war that ultimately brought about the end of the first Star League. Covering the fighting that followed Kerensky's conquest of the Rim Worlds Republic and the early stages of the Hegemony campaign to the final conclusive battles on Terra itself, this book provides a hard look at the last days of the Star League Era, and the fateful decisions that would eventually pave the way for centuries of Succession Wars to come.

Battletech Historicals series delves into the pivotal wars of the Inner Sphere’s thousand-year history, with important personalities, maps of individual attack waves and regiment listings, along with a campaign framework that allows players to enact every aspect of each of these important events.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat
BattleTech: A Time of War – The BattleTech RPG

boardgame.name: The Lost Duke
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

The planet of Brufort has always managed to remain under the radar of Charted Space at large. The mining companies support their workers as they bring up bountiful hauls of precious Zuchai crystals and, despite the presence of dangerous fauna, the people were happy. That happiness would not last.

boardgame.name: The Bell of Rocamadour
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Alpha Crucis was the site of the second great Solomani expansion, its uncharted worlds were fallow ground for generations of explorers and colonists. In the rush to snap up Earth Prime worlds, many lesser systems were left behind. Rocamadour is just such a place.

boardgame.name: Enemy of My Enemy
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Piracy has become a problem in District 268. The Travellers are sent on a mission to Collace, an Imperial client state and important ally. With the imminent annexation of the subsector, the Imperium does not want to inherit a troubled region so they are sending the Travellers' ship to troubleshoot the situation.

boardgame.name: The City of Starlight
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Tasked with obtaining an important item for a ritual, adventurers take a trip to the domain of Starlight, just in time for a cultural festival: the Silent Bazaar.
They'll need to embark on a scavenger hunt through the tropical paradise to get what they need.

Part 1 of 3 of the Calamity Jar series.

A 4-Hour Adventure for Tier 1 characters. Optimized for APL 3.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: Fuzzytail Farm and the Frightful Candy Goat Massacre
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Liars Night 2021

FUZZYTAIL FARM AND THE FRIGHTFUL CANDY GOAT MASSACRE

A frightful catastrophe has struck the Fuzzytail farm. You are called in to help set things right. This adventure contains family friendly scares, along with options to ramp up the horror for older audiences.

Content Warnings: abuse (harassment, livestock theft), non-painful and non-lethal dismemberment, possible phobia trigger (spiders, insects, bats).

“Make it Scarier” Optional Content Warnings: gore (dismemberment), death (exsanguination, humanoids as food)

This product is only available until November 30th 2021.

It is legal for D&D Adventurers League play through Dec 31st 2021.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: Reisende des Südtigris
Viajantes do Sul do Tigre
Wayfarers of the South Tigris
Мандрівники Південного Тигру
boardgame.description:
Wayfarers of the South Tigris is set during the height of the Abbasid Caliphate, circa 820 AD. As brave explorers, cartographers and astronomers, players set off from Baghdad to map the surrounding land, waterways, and heavens above. Players must carefully manage their caravan of workers and equipment, while reporting back regularly to journal their findings at the House of Wisdom. Will you succeed in impressing the Caliph, or lose your way and succumb to the wilderness?

The aim of Wayfarers of the South Tigris is to be the player with the most victory points (VP) at the game's end. Points are primarily gained by mapping the land, water, and sky. Players can also gain points from upgrading their caravans, by gaining inspiration from nobles, and by influencing the three guilds of science, trade and exploration. As they make discoveries, players will want to quickly journal their progress. The game ends once one player’s marker has reached the far right column of the journal track.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamepodcastepisode: Ep 33: Wayfarers of the South Tigris - By Garphill Games
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Wayfarers of the South Tigris: Kickstarter Promo Cards
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Wayfarers of the South Tigris: Metal Coin Set

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: In the Court of the Frozen Queen
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Something bad must have happened in the village Fairhaven. The caravan that went there is missing, and no one from the village comes to neighboring cities. Rangers report that an abandoned tower in the mountains is being rebuilt, and those who wandered close to the city tell the story of a frozen building in the middle of the city. Ice Queen arrived - bards say, cautiously telling the tale they overheard in Fairhaven - and the valley is going to freeze.

A group of adventurers gathers in the Dragon Head inn, worried about the things they heard. They do not know what they will find in the north, but they know one thing - to save the people of the valley they must go and get an audience In the Court of the Frozen Queen.

In the Court of the Frozen Queen is a full-fledged adventure. Full of mysteries to unravel, monsters to fight, riddles to solve, and magical treasures to be found! Adventure is designed around level 2 to level 4, with an optional prologue that will bring characters from level one to level two and will introduce them to the story.

boardgame.name: Thaumaturge
boardgame.description:
Thaumaturge is a two player card game where instead of drawing cards at random, you can take whichever one you want. During your play, you can take three actions, which include adding cards to your hand, playing cards, and using actions on certain cards you've already played.

You win if your opponent has no cards remaining in their crux, and their discard pile, and no effect is in the process of resolving.

boardgame.name: Luigi's Mansion Jumpchain
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Luigi, Mario's more cowardly and humble younger brother, finally thought he'd caught a break when he saw the letter in his mail saying he'd won a mansion in a contest! The only problem being that he didn't enter the contest in the first place. Finding it shady, but not wanting to pass up the opportunity, Luigi and Mario agreed to meet up outside the mansion and investigate together. By the time Luigi had made it to the mansion Mario was nowhere to be found. Despite his fear, the cowardly younger brother figures Mario must be inside and so he enters on his own. You've wound up in the mansion too, one way or another, and with a bit of currency to help you along your way. Can you survive one night in the mansion?

boardgame.name: Warhammer 40,000: The Dark Eldar
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

It is the 42nd Millennium. For ten thousand years the Dark Eldar have been rapacious pirates and cruel slavers. From the immeasurably vast city of Commorragh or one of its satellite realms, fleets bearing unfathomably advanced technologies set out to menace the galaxy. Their weapons are speed, surprise, and overwhelming firepower. They strike where their foes are weak and return home with a bounty of playthings for Commorragh. The Dark Eldar rely upon such raiding, as without a steady supply of souls theirs would be devoured by Slaanesh, the god they spawned.

boardgame.name: Fire Force
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

250 years ago, the world was rent apart in an event known as the Great Cataclysm. Amid the flames of devastation, entire continents were torn apart and reduced to ashes, with some landmasses erased entirely amidst inexplicable rifts in space. Countless millions died, and many who survived must have wished they had not, for alongside the Cataclysm came Spontaneous Human Combustion.

boardgame.name: Zeitgeist Campaign Primer
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

In the Zeitgeist campaign, your characters serve in the Royal Homeland Constabulary of the nation of Risur, protecting the country and its citizens from foreign threats lurking within its borders.

boardgame.name: Critical Role: Call of the Netherdeep
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




Publisher's blurb:

The greed of mortals has awakened a powerful entity long thought destroyed. For eons, this mighty champion of the gods has been imprisoned in the darkest depths of Exandria. His name has been forgotten, as have his heroic deeds. Languishing in despair, he calls out for new heroes to save him.

Inspired by the campaigns of the hit series Critical Role, this Dungeons & Dragons adventure begins in the Wastes of Xhorhas and leads to the glimmering oasis-city of Ank’Harel on the continent of Marquet, and from there into a sunken realm of gloom, corruption, and sorrow known as the Netherdeep. Above it all, the red moon of Ruidus watches, twisting the fates of those who have the power to shape the course of history.
boardgame.rpgissuearticle: Critical Role: Call of the Netherdeep

boardgame.name: Magic: the Gathering: Planes of the Multiverse - A Visual History
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The many planes of Magic: The Gathering’s storied Multiverse have served as host to countless epic battles and dramatic cataclysms—and each world is richly and uniquely populated with its own fantastical creatures, iconic characters, and legendary Planeswalkers. In Magic: The Gathering: Planes of the Multiverse, author Jay Annelli presents a visual guide to the history behind lore-defining events from the Phyrexian Invasion to the War of the Spark, as well as character profiles for Karn, Narset, Vraska, Sorin Markov, and other fan-favorite Planeswalkers.

Planes of the Multiverse pairs original artwork—in many instances reproduced for the first time outside of the card frame—with detailed primers on each plane. This collection offers exclusive insight into the art and mythology of some of Magic: The Gathering’s most popular and enduring locales—and the characters that inhabit them.

User summary:

Includes sections for:

Plane Shift: Dominaria
Plane Shift: Kaladesh
Plane Shift: Amonkhet
Plane Shift: Ixalan
Plane Shift: Zendikar
Plane Shift: Innistrad
Mirrodin
New Phyrexia
Tarkir
Alara
Ravnica
Arcavios
Eldraine
Fiora
Ikoria
Kaldheim
Kylem
Theros
Kamigawa
boardgame.rpgcategory: Non-Rankable Item (item will not show in the rankings)

boardgame.name: Hot Wheels Unleashed
boardgame.description:
Collect the raddest cars. Race and build the most insane tracks. Live an unprecedented level of challenge that will put you to the test.

PURE RACING FUN!

Source: The Game Website.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2021 The Game Awards Best Sports/Racing Game of the Year Nominee
boardgame.videogameversion: North American XBOX Series X|S edition

boardgame.name: Slow Sleigh to Plankton Downs
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A journey to the glaciated world of Mora's Misstep lands the players in the middle of a whodunit aboard the Nantucket Sleigh Ride as they attempt to uncover the truth behind the mysterious murders plaguing the ship. Will they reveal the culprit or suffer a cold, lonely demise on the face of the unforgiving ice?

boardgame.name: Smart Assistant Interrogator
boardgame.description:
A reverse-trivia game for adults that uses a smart assistant (Google, Alexa, Siri, etc). Pick a card from 4 categories in play and get the smart assistant to say the word or name on the card while following a set of rules of things you can not do. The base game comes with 10 categories with 36 game cards in each as well as a 36 card cheat deck.

4 categories are chosen at random. 6 Game cards from each chosen category are stacked below each matching category card. Play starts in the clockwise rotation. The player chooses a category and then selects the top card from its deck. They must now get the SA to say the word or name on the card, without saying it and by following other rules such as - no spelling, no present or past tense versions of the word etc.

When the 24 game cards are gone, the game is over, and the person with the most wins. Easy right?

boardgame.name: Micro Chrome
boardgame.description:
Penny Arcade's blurb:

Celebrate the series and rep your Cyberflair with enamel images of Cyberpunk 2020 Cover, Danger Gal, Chibi GRAF3, and Siete in this brightly colored rendering of the Dark Future, straight from the Edge. There’s a world full of opportunities out there with four brand new playable items found on the back of this set to incorporate into your game. Maybe this time you can do more than save yourself. Maybe.

R. Talsorian's blurb:
